metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13844 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-13844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
g++-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
g++-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-base - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-hppa64-linux-gnu - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-locales - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-offload-amdgcn - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-offload-nvptx - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-source - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-test-results - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gccbrig-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1

gccgo-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1

gdc-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1

lib32go16 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1

libgm2-15 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgnat-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgnat-util10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgo16 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgomp-plugin-hsa1 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1

No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> gcc-3.3 only provides libstdc++5 mdeslaur> Fixing this in stable release would likely require rebuilding the whole archive using the fixed compiler. Deferring CVE for now until further information is available. sbeattie> fixed upstream in 10.3.0

criterions.comment: gcc-10 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.0-5ubuntu1').
gcc-3.3 package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
gcc-8 package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
